RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MATSQUI settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, advanced quickly from along the rail midway down the backstretch to force the issue from the outside of B C CHRISTIE entering the final turn, and wore that rival down in the final strides to prevail. B C CHRISTIE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, assumed command approaching the final turn, was quickly tackled by MATSQUI entering the turn, and just failed to last following a stretch long battle. C C SUNRISE away alertly and raced to the lead while drifting two out from the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace into the backstretch, was overtaken nearing the final turn, saved ground through the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to hold on for a share. PETERSON LANDING away well and was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two wide entering the backside, rallied three wide through the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response while finishing four wide in the drive. HIGHER IMAGE settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, trailed the field in the run to the final turn, and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Peterson Landing
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: B C Christie
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, led, rallied 2w, closed 2w, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Matsqui
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Elder Matt and Breen Bill
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2w, advanced 3/8, rallied 2w, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Higher Image
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FINDING WAYS away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, turned back a challenge from VALUABLE COWBOY through the final turn and into the lane, and held sway late. PARKER POINT unhurried early and trailed the field into the backstretch while racing out from the rail, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn, split rivals entering the lane, and closed determinedly three out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place in the final strides. VALUABLE COWBOY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, battled through the final turn and into the stretch from the outside of FINDING WAYS, was unable to match strides with that rival in the stretch and just failed to miss the place. COUNTRY COWBOY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied from along the inside through the final turn, but needed more late while finishing three wide in the drive. BLACK METAL broke sharply and stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, checked briefly entering the lane, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Black Metal
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO $6,300 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A R ace Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHAMRA unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed with a rush five wide in the drive to prove best. VIVA LA VINO away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from the inside of BUNNY in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of her pace rival leaving the turn, and finished three wide in the drive. BUNNY was leaning in the gate prior to the start and got away awkwardly, rushed up to duel two wide entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the lane, but closed determinedly four wide in the drive to just miss the place. KAPALUA CANDY was fractious prior to the start, and raced up to stalk the dueling leaders into the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but had little to offer late while finishing three wide in the drive. QUALITY COMMAND settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a late bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Quality Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Vino
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, led, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Kapalua Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, stalked inside, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Shamra
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Bunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races Not Considered For Allowances) (Preference To Horses That Ha ve Not Started For Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AT ATTENTION stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backside, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two out from the rail in the drive to prevail. PAY MY WAY settled at the back of a compact field while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, shifted four wide entering the lane, and closed willingly through the stretch to just miss. FLORIDA GATOR away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of SIR BREGOVIC entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside and through the final turn, put away his pace rival leaving the turn, but was quickly tackled by AT ATTENTION and PAY MY WAY, but battled gamely two wide in the drive to just miss. ROOKIE YEAR broke sharply and stalked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly just out from the rail through the final turn while awaiting room, and finished evenly three wide in the drive. SIR BREGOVIC away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the lane the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of FLORIDA GATOR in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bregovic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Rookie Year
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: At Attention
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Florida Gator
ENTRY.OWNER: Potozny Larry Langelaan Peter and Wil - A - Way Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DYNAMITER away well and sprinted to a clear lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive while holding SOMTHING ELUSIVE safely at bay late to prove best. SOMTHING ELUSIVE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the stretch the first time, pulled himself into a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide through the final turn to loom a danger, but needed more late while proving easily second best. MILO'S COMMAND broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pacesetter while racing two wide entering the lane the first time, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished evenly to garner a share. BE SPARKY unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time, rallied along the inside from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late charge. WELLSLEY away alertly and stalked the leader into the stretch the first time, struggled to hold his position in the run down the backside, began to drop back in the run to the final turn, and wasn't persevered with late.

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, clear lead, rallied 2 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: Wellsley
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Milo's Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pr ice $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: Y VEE R away alertly and sprinted to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, opened a clear advantage into the final turn, and held off the closers in deep stretch to prevail. WISELY PLAYED settled off the early pace while racing two wide entering the stretch the first time, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished with a rush three wide in the drive to get up for the place. LOGICAL AL settled well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, launched hid bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive and just failed to hold the place. KLIMTOGLORY settled off the early pace while saving ground along the inside through the stretch the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive. EDDIE WHO stalked the leaders from along the rail through the stretch the first time while racing in tight quarters, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but was outfinished late while racing one out from the rail in the drive. CAB SAV away well and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished over the final furlong while finishing three wide in the drive. MAJESTIC STREET stalked the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, began to struggle to hold his position while racing four wide into the final turn, and weakened in the late stages. BACK SHACK broke sharply and tracked the leader one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Al
ENTRY.OWNER: Canoe Pass Stables and MacPherson Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, trailed, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Cab Sav
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Y Vee R
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilker Robert Gilker Victoria and Chu Ernie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 18 Allow ed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKEITORBREAKIT settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, and closed with a rush from along the rail in the drive to get up in the final strides. RACING RIVER tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, assumed control midway through the turn and just failed to last while finishing three wide in the drive. KNOPFLER settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, shifted four wide for the drive, and finished evenly to garner a share. BODEGA lagged well off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing five wide in the drive. ACE DEUCE lagged well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and improved his position late while finishing two wide in the drive. QUAGMIRE stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, loomed a danger leaving the turn, but was outfinished in the drive while racing two out from the rail. VALUE MAX settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. RING OF KERRY settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied four wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. IT'S IN COMMAND rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was overtaken midway through the turn, and weakened in the late stages. ANOTHER GUINNESS unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn, began to lose touch with the field in the run down the backstretch and wasn't persevered with over the final furlong while being eased in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Ace Deuce
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: It's in Command
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, closed 3 wide, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more
